intro: Sclarea tingitana, commonly known as the Moroccan angelica, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and compound leaves that are aromatic and finely divided. Its small, white flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Sclarea tingitana is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional remedies for various ailments.
